TextView.android:text: The issuance or approval of a subdivision development permit, in accordance with RA 7279, Executive Order No. 648, Presidential Decree 957, Batas Pambansa Bldg. 220, and related implementing rules and regulations, is a crucial process in the development of subdivisions. This permit signifies compliance with legal requirements and ensures that the subdivision project adheres to the established guidelines for land subdivision project.
All transacting public, business entities and other government agencies
1. Application Form duly accomplished with attached list of requirements (3 Original and Notarized Copies)

2. Final Subdivision Development Plan duly prepared, signed and sealed by a licensed and registered architect, environment planner, civil engineer or geodetic engineer consisting of the site development plan at any of the following scales: 1:200; 1:1,000; or any scale not exceeding 1:2,000; showing all proposals including the following (3 Copies): 

a. Roads, easements or right-of-way and roadway width, alignment, gradient, and similar data for alleys, if any. 
b. Lot numbers, lines and areas and block numbers. 
c. Site data such as number of residential and saleable lots, typical lot size, parks and playgrounds and open spaces.

3. Engineering Plans showing the alignment, elevations, typical cross sections and details of road system, water supply system, drainage and sewerage disposal facilities, power distribution system and street lighting plan (3 Copies)
4. Vicinity Map/Topographic Plan/Survey Plan signed by a licensed Geodetic Engineer to include existing conditions such as boundary lines: bearing and distances (3 Copies)
5. Certified true copy of Title, Tax Declaration and Current Tax Receipt and other evidence of ownership or intent to sell and authority to develop signed by the owner (3 Copies)

If CADT Area: 
► COLO/COLA (per resolution no. 458) 
► Contract of Usufruct 
► FEMMATRICS Certification recognizing area occupied/allotted (signed by the chairman) 
► Area Survey
6. Certified true copy of Environmental Compliance Certificate (ECC) or Certificate of Non-coverage (CNC) whichever is applicable (1 Copy)
Department of Environment and Natural Resources
Department of Human Settlements and Urban Development (DHSUD) Regional Office
8. Certified true copy of Conversion Order

9. Project Description for projects having an area of 1 hectare and above to include project profile indicating the cost of raw land and its development (total project costs), amortization schedule, sources of financing, cash flow, architectural plan, if any, and work program; audited financial statement for the last 3 preceding years; income tax return for the last 3 preceding years; Certificate of Registration from Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC); Articles of incorporation or partnership; Corporation by-laws and all implementing amendments; and for new corporations (3 years and below), statement of capitalization and sources of income and cash flow to support work program (3 Copies)
10. Plans, specifications, bills of materials and cost estimates duly signed and sealed by the appropriate licensed professionals
11. Application for permit to drill or permit for operation of Deep Well, and a water resistivity test if and when necessary (3 Copies)
12. Traffic Impact Assessment (TIA) for subdivision projects 30 hectares and above (3 Copies)
13. Copy of the special/temporary permit and of the separate permit for foreign architects who signed on plans required under the Implementing Rules and Regulations of Presidential Decree 957.
Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE)

14. List of names of duly licensed professionals who signed the plan and other similar documents in connection with application filed with requirements indicating the following information (3 Copies): 

► Surname/First/Middle/Maiden Name 
► Professional License No., date of issued and expiration of its validity 
► Professional Tax receipt, date of issued 
► Taxpayer’s Identification Number (TIN)
17. DPWH RROW Clearance (Subject to MPDO & MEO verification)
18. Notarized Authorization of persons allowed to transact/follow-up the certificate
1. Submit Notarized Application Form and the complete required documents to the receiving officer for initial assessment and verification and secure the Order of Payment.
1.1. Provide the Log Book to the Client
1.2. Receive and record the Application Form and the complete required documents
1.3. Review, assess, and evaluate the submitted documents
1.5. Issue the Assessment and Order of Payment
1.7. For non-conforming, Sangguniang Bayan or the Local Zoning Board of Appeal will conduct technical review
2. Claim the Locational Clearance at the Office of the Municipal Planning and Development Coordinator
2.1. Check the Official Receipt and record the transaction in the releasing logbook
2.2. Release the certification to the client
3. Accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) and drop it in the Feedback Box
3.1. Request the client to accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS)
Housing and Land Use Regulatory Board 2013 Schedule of Fees
A. Single residential structure attached or detached
₱3,600 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million regardless of the number of floors )
₱3,600 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million regardless of the number of floors )
₱2,880 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
E. Commercial, Industrial and Agro-Industrial Project Cost of which is:
₱7,200 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
(Gasoline Station, Cell Sites, Slaughter House, Treatment Plants, etc.)
₱7,200 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
₱7,200 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
